reg.msg_field: Date of enrollment of first participant
Date of enrollment of first participant_
reg.msg_content: Date of enrollment of first participant

The Committee reviewed this protocol and on (date) determined that it is approved for implementation in (country) until (date). An extension to this approval must be requested if the project extends beyond the date herein specified.

The registration of all clinical trials is a scientific and ethical responsibility. Every clinical trial must be registered in a publicly accessible database before recruitment of the first participant. We invite researchers to plan the publication and use of research results. We encourage the publication in indexed open access journals. Please inform other ethics committees about this decision. You must also inform us about any significant changes to the implementation of this protocol.

The Committee reviewed this protocol and on (date) determined that it is not approved. In your response you must include a succinct letter addressing the issues raised by the Committee, and send an updated copy of your protocol in which the changes made to the original version are highlighted.
Favorable balance of benefits and risks

Dear Investigator,

Please see messages below and click on "edit this project" to modify your submission.

To add a new member of the research team it is required to register him/her previously on this platform. To sign-up a new investigator it is required to go to the login information screen on the system.
Template to report an adverse event
1. Social value Can the study lead to improvements in health and well-being? What is the potential value of the research for each of the prospective beneficiaries?

2. Scientific validity Is the investigation methodologically valid and scientifically (and statistically) sound? Will the study generate valid and reliable data that can be generalizable and useful? Does the study design realize the scientific objectives while guaranteeing participants the health-care interventions to which they are entitled? Is the study feasible?

3. Fair participant selection What are the criteria to include and exclude participants? Is selection of participants based on scientific criteria? Is the research population selected to minimize risks to participants? Are individual research participants selected to maximize potential benefits? If participants are vulnerable, are there any safeguards to protect them? Are the risks and potential benefits of the study fairly distributed?

4. Favorable risk-benefit ratio Can the risks for participants be minimized? Can potential benefits for individuals and society be improved? Do the potential benefits for society and individuals outweigh the risks?

5. Informed consent Is the information provided to potential participants accurate, clear, relevant and complete? Are the recruitment procedures, consent process and incentives appropriate for their culture and context? Is there an appropriate plan for obtaining permission for those that canÂt consent for themselves? Are the participants being made aware of their right to refuse to participate and are they actually free to refuse?

6. Respect for participants How will the health and well-being of participants be monitored to minimize harms? How will their privacy be protected? Can participants withdraw from the study without penalty? What are the plans of care after the study is completed? Will participants be given any new information (including the results of the study)?

Solicitud de extensiÃ³n de la aprobaciÃ³n
1. Valor social Â¿Puede el estudio mejorar la salud y el bienestar? Â¿CuÃ¡l es el valor potencial de la investigaciÃ³n para cada uno de los beneficiarios prospecto?

2. Validez cientÃ­fica Â¿Es la investigaciÃ³n metodolÃ³gicamente vÃ¡lida y cientÃ­ficamente (y estadÃ­sticamente) rigurosa? Â¿GenerarÃ¡ el estudio datos vÃ¡lidos y confiables que pueden ser generalizables y Ãºtiles? Â¿Realiza el diseÃ±o del estudio los objetivos cientÃ­ficos al mismo tiempo que garantiza a los participantes las intervenciones en salud a las cuales tienen derecho? Â¿Es este un estudio factible?

3. SelecciÃ³n justa de participantes Â¿Cuales son los criterios de inclusion y exclusion de participantes? Â¿Se basa la selecciÃ³n de participantes en criterios cientÃ­ficos? Â¿Se selecciona la poblaciÃ³n de la investigaciÃ³n para minimizer los riesgos de los participantes? Â¿Se selecciona a los participantes individuales de la investigaciÃ³n para maximar los posibles beneficios? Si hay participantes vulnerables, Â¿existen salvaguardas para protegerlos de daÃ±os? Â¿Se distribuyen equitativamente los riesgos y posibles beneficios del estudio?

4. RelaciÃ³n favorable de riesgo-beneficio Â¿Pueden minimizarse los riesgos para los participantes? Â¿Pueden mejorarse los posibles beneficios para los individuos y para la sociedad? Los posibles beneficios para la sociedad e individuos, Â¿sobrepasan los riesgos?

4. Consentimiento informado La informaciÃ³n que se prove a los posibles participantes, Â¿es exacta, clara, relevante y complete? Los procedimientos de reclutamiento, consentimiento e incentivos, Â¿son apropiados para su cultura y context? Â¿Hay un plan apropriado para obtener el permiso de aquellos que no pueden copnsentir por si mismos? Â¿Se les hace saber a los participantes sobre su derecho de rehusarse a participar y son de hecho libres de rehusarse?

6. Respeto para con los participantes Â¿CÃ³mo se monitorearÃ¡ la salud y bienestar de los participantes para minimizer los daÃ±os? Â¿CÃ³mo se protegerÃ¡ su privacidad? Â¿Pueden los participantes retirarse del estudio sin ninguna sanciÃ³n? Â¿CuÃ¡les son los planes de atenciÃ³n despuÃ©s que termine el estudio? Â¿Se le darÃ¡ alguna nueva informaciÃ³n a los participantes (incluyendo los resultados del estudio)?

Modelo de relatÃ³rio de evento adverso
1. Validade Social O estudo pode contribuir para o aprimoramento cientÃ­fico e saÃºde? Qual o potencial valor da pesquisa para cada benefÃ­cio?

SerÃ¡ que o desenho do estudo a se realizar contempla os objetivos cientÃ­ficos, garantindo que as intervenÃ§Ãµes preservam a integridade do participante? O estudo Ã© viÃ¡vel?

3. CritÃ©rios de InclusÃ£o e ExclusÃ£o da amostra Ã a populaÃ§Ã£o da pesquisa selecionado para minimizar os riscos para os participantes? SÃ£o participantes da pesquisa individuais selecionados para maximizar os benefÃ­cios potenciais? SÃ£o os potenciais riscos e benefÃ­cios do estudo distribuÃ­dos de forma justa? O estudo nÃ£o pode ser realizado de outra forma?

4. Favorable risk-benefit ratio Can the risks for participants be minimized? Can potential benefits for individuals and society be improved? Do the potential benefits for society and individuals outweigh the risks?

5. Informed consent Is the information provided to potential participants accurate, clear, relevant and complete? Are the recruitment procedures, consent process and incentives appropriate for their culture and context? Is there an appropriate plan for obtaining permission for those that canÂt consent for themselves? Are the participants being made aware of their right to refuse to participate and are they actually free to refuse?

6. Respect for participants How will the health and well-being of participants be monitored to minimize harms? How will their privacy be protected? Can participants withdraw from the study without penalty? What are the plans of care after the study is completed? Will participants be given any new information (including the results of the study)?
